climbs.name: The Shaman
climbs.fa: Curt Lyons, Kevin Mokracek & Troy Mayr, 1990

content.description:
In-your-face from the start this Generation Wall classic powers up steep jugs to a slight runout and exciting moves over an arching roof midway. Past the roof the angle eases and it's a simple matter of holding on for the ride to the anchors.

Being flexible helps on this as some stemming down low keeps the pump at bay and endurance isn't a bad thing either.
content.location: Center of the wall above a slab of rock. A prominent arched roof midway which the route passes over is a helpful feature to locate the route.

content.description: Super fun climbing up to and along a steep flake system to a first set of anchors (5.10a if you stop here) then continue above past two more bolts and a crux section along a steep flake to anchors atop the flake.
content.protection: 8 bolts, sport anchors (take one extra quickdraw to clip the lower anchor)
content.location: Right side of the wall at the point where the ground becomes level. Look for the obvious flake system which markes the route.

content.description:
A vertical start on positive holds transitions into steep slab with engaging moves using pockets and edges.

This is the straight-up line of bolts; the line of bolts branching out left from the 2nd bolt belong to the route

Second Generation

(5.10b).
content.location: Far left side of the wall; it's the leftmost line of bolts.
